snippet: As part of a 24-hour operation in the Rockaways, truckloads of sand washed away by Hurricane Sandy are being poured through super-size versions of children’s toy sifters.
abstract: New York City Parks Dept has been busy in Rockaways for over month in 24-hour-a-day operation cleaning tons of sand displaced by Hurricane Sandy so that it can be used to rebuild area beaches; thousands of truckloads of sand have been sifted to remove all manner of debris, from boardwalk slats to household trash, in project overseen by the Army Corps of Engineers.
lead_paragraph: As part of a 24-hour operation in the Rockaways, truckloads of sand washed away by Hurricane Sandy are being poured through super-size versions of children’s toy sifters.

headline.seo: After Hurricane Sandy, Cleaning Up Sand and Returning It to Beaches
headline.main: Before Rebuilding Beaches, Plucking Debris From Storm-Tossed Sand
headline.print_headline: Before Rebuilding Beaches, Plucking Debris From Storm-Tossed Sand
